item.title: Please welcome Katie Keyser!
item.dc:creator: Susan Boone
item.description:
Katie’s joining the Collection Management unit as our Electronic Resources Specialist. She comes to us from UCB where she managed electronic books, databases, and journals. She will be our primary point person for analyzing and resolving access problems for electronic resources. She’s an avid quilter—her current project is a baby ...

Read morePlease welcome Katie Keyser!

item.title: Electronic Resources Specialist position open
item.dc:creator: Susan Boone
item.description:
Collection Management has a full-time, one year Electronic Resources Specialist position open. This position will maintain timely and accurate representation of electronic resources access points in the integrated library system, discovery tool, link resolver, and A to Z list, and collect online resource usage data.  The posting is here: https://tinyurl.com/y52c642m   If ...

Read moreElectronic Resources Specialist position open

item.title: Welcome Cat Lu!
item.dc:creator: Susan Boone
item.description:
I am very happy to introduce our new Metadata Analyst, Cat Lu. She will provide expertise and leadership in the development and implementation of metadata strategies to enhance the discoverability of Library resources. Cat was previously the Digital Projects and Metadata Librarian at the Science History Institute in Philadelphia. There ...

Read moreWelcome Cat Lu!

item.title: Our new Metadata Analyst is Cathleen Lu!
item.dc:creator: Susan Boone
item.description: I’m thrilled to announce that Cathleen (Cat) has accepted the Metadata Analyst position! Cat will be here Monday, July 30. Please look for a more formal announcement and introduction when she arrives.

item.title: Now Hiring: Metadata Analyst
item.dc:creator: Susan Boone
item.description:
Hi all, Collection Management is hiring for a Metadata Analyst. This position will provide expertise in all things metadata for the library. They will serve as a liaison or adviser to internal and external research partners on collaborative metadata projects, such as library collaborations involving clinical information systems and terminologies.  ...

Read moreNow Hiring: Metadata Analyst

item.title: Metadata Analyst position feedback
item.dc:creator: Susan Boone
item.description:
Good morning! Collection Management is excited to share the Metadata Analyst position for your feedback. As Chris detailed in his email last week, we would also appreciate your suggestions for places to advertise (this will be a national search), and potential search committee members. You’ll find two documents in Box : ...

item.title: David MacFarland Retires December 22
item.dc:creator: Susan Boone
item.description:
David is leaving us for a well-earned retirement. David had been the Operations Manager at the UC Berkeley Anthropology Library when he came to work here in 2011. He brought ten years of library technical services experience including heading the UCB periodicals check-in unit which processed over 25,000 subscriptions. Of ...

Read moreDavid MacFarland Retires December 22

item.title: Diversity Statement added to the Library’s Web Pages
item.dc:creator: Susan Boone
item.description:
As a first step toward ensuring that the Library’s diversity and inclusion values are reflected in our policies, processes, and communication, the D&I Work Group has drafted a statement and broad set of goals for acting on those values. On the About the Library page, our Mission, Vision, and Values ...

Read moreDiversity Statement added to the Library’s Web Pages

item.title: SPOT Award : Alan Daniel
item.dc:creator: Susan Boone
item.description:
Managing user access is a multi-faceted set of tasks. Authenticating remote access has several twists to it. Recently, the Medical Center asked the Library to handle setting up the authentication for their access to UpToDate, a very popular and heavily used resource. The content provider gave a deadline of October ...

Read moreSPOT Award : Alan Daniel

item.title: Gilda Radner was right – It’s Always Something!
item.dc:creator: Susan Boone
item.description:
During last Fall’s implementation of EZproxy, OCLC’s authentication software, we discovered that the previous URLs supplied by ProQuest in our catalog records to access UCSF Dissertations in ProQuest Dissertations & Theses database did not work with OCLC’s software. Typically we can batch update records through a find and replace, but ...

Read moreGilda Radner was right – It’s Always Something!
